meanings.definition: To give money in exchange for goods or services.
meanings.sent1: She pays for her groceries at the store.
meanings.sent2: He always pays the mechanic after fixing his car.
meanings.sent3: The cat pays for the toy mouse with pretend money.
meanings.sent4: The sun pays for its warmth with golden rays.
meanings.sent5: The student pays for the school lunch with coins.

meanings.definition: To suffer a loss or penalty.
meanings.sent1: He pays for being late by missing the beginning of the movie.
meanings.sent2: She pays for forgetting her umbrella by getting soaked in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The dog pays for digging up the garden by having to wear a funny hat.
meanings.sent4: The tree pays for its height by swaying in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The player pays for the foul by sitting out the next game.

meanings.sent1: Investing in stocks pays off in the long run.
meanings.sent2: Hard work always pays in achieving your goals.
meanings.sent3: The clown pays by making people laugh and smile.
meanings.sent4: Kindness pays in creating lasting friendships.
meanings.sent5: Education pays by opening doors to new opportunities.
